security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill with no executable code. Contains only SKILL.md file with TypeScript examples for the @delon/util library.

content.user_title: Use utility functions for data manipulation
content.value_statement: Complex data manipulation tasks require multiple helper functions. This skill provides ready-to-use utilities for array operations, string formatting, date calculations, and number formatting in Angular projects.
actual_capabilities: Deep copy and merge arrays and objects
Calculate date ranges and relative time
Check empty values and deep equality
limitations: Browser utilities only work in browser environment

use_cases.title: Data transformation in components
use_cases.description: Transform and format data for display in Angular templates using utility functions

use_cases.title: Form data handling
use_cases.description: Clone and merge form data with default values safely without mutating originals

use_cases.title: API response processing
use_cases.description: Process and normalize API responses using deep copy and grouping utilities

prompt_templates.title: Deep copy objects
prompt_templates.prompt: Use deepCopy to create an independent copy of this object. Show how changes to the copy do not affect the original.

prompt_templates.title: Format strings
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the format function to create a message with template variables. Demonstrate both indexed and named parameters.

prompt_templates.title: Calculate date ranges
prompt_templates.prompt: Use getTimeDistance to get the start and end dates for this week. Show how to calculate relative dates with offset.

prompt_templates.title: Group and sort data
prompt_templates.prompt: Use groupBy and orderBy to organize this list of items. Group by status field and sort by priority.

output_examples.input: Format the currency value 1234567.89 as USD and show how to format with different precision levels

best_practices: Use deepCopy for immutability when modifying state objects
Wrap grouping and sorting in computed signals for reactivity
Import specific utilities to enable tree-shaking
anti_patterns: Mutating original objects instead of using deepCopy
Calling deepCopy on very large objects frequently
Using browser utilities in server-side rendering context

faq.question: What Angular versions are supported?
faq.answer: Works with Angular 16+ including standalone components and signals support.

faq.question: What is the package size impact?
faq.answer: Individual imports enable tree-shaking. Most utilities are under 1KB gzipped.

faq.question: How do I install the package?
faq.answer: Run npm install @delon/util@20.1.0 and import utilities from @delon/util/[category].

faq.question: Is my data safe with deepCopy?
faq.answer: Yes. deepCopy creates complete independent clones. Original objects remain unmodified.

faq.question: Why is copyToClipboard async?
faq.answer: Clipboard API requires user permission. The async function handles permission requests properly.

faq.question: How does this compare to lodash?
faq.answer: Smaller bundle size and Angular-specific optimizations. Compatible API for common use cases.
